Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body section of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous material, exterior covered with a brown-coloured slip and remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.198-200)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36481) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36481)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 345 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
